alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 5:29AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Elbert, southeastern Hart, southern Anderson and central Abbeville Counties through 600 AM EST... At 529 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Anderson to 10 miles southeast of Carnesville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Hartwell, Homeland Park, Belton, Honea Path, Due West, Iva, Bowman, Lake Secession and Donalds. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
